item.title: Rhombus Desktop
item.description: About Rhombus Desktop Features Installation Creating a new wallet Staking Recommended for beginners and majority of users Preview of Rhombus Desktop 3.0 About Rhombus Desktop While it does not currently contain all advanced features (like Rhombus Core), Rhombus Desktop is a recommended wallet for majority of users. This wallet is intended to be the centerpiece and default wallet of the Rhombus platform and is heavily under development.

item.title: Rhombus Core
item.description: Preview of Rhombus Core Rhombus Core is more lightweight than Rhombus Desktop, offers some advanced features like Coin Control and compatibility with hardware wallets. However it acts like a wallet only, so you won’t have access to Rhombus Open Marketplace. Download Rhombus Core Report bugs Features Browse & compare Rhombus Core’s features with other available wallets. Getting started Installation Please note that even though some of these steps are optional/recommended, it is highly advised to follow all of them as it secures your funds from being lost.

item.title: Ledger Wallet
item.description: Ledger Nano S About Ledger Wallet Requirements Installation Ledger Rhombus app Rhombus Core configuration Usage Sending RHOM using Ledger Cold staking on Ledger About Ledger Wallet Ledger Nano (S/X) is a hardware wallet which stores user’s private keys in a secure hardware device. Hardware wallets have major advantages over standard software wallets: private keys are stored in a secure chip, and cannot be transferred out of the device.

item.title: Rhombus Copay
item.description: About Rhombus Copay While it doesn’t offer all of available features (compared to other Rhombus wallets) it offers some unique ones. Mainly, Rhombus Copay is the most accessible mobile Rhombus wallet and allows user-friendly multisignature wallets for increased security of your funds, or even sharing the wallet across multiple people.
